title: Entertainment Live: Bradley Cooper imposter uncovered, Dad's Army stars attend premiere - BBC News
summary: news and updates for wednesday 27 january 2016 .
dad 's army stars attend world premiere in london .
bradley cooper imposter uncovered at sundance film festival .
woman 's hour launches monthly late-night show .

documents.title: and we 're done
text: that 's all we have time for on today 's live page , but we 'll be back tomorrow with another busy bulletin full of arts and entertainment news .

we 'll leave you with a newly released clip from sacha baron cohen 's upcoming comedy grimsby , a spy spoof about a resourceful secret agent ( mark strong ) with an achilles heel in the form of a spectacularly gormless brother ( guess who ?
warning : this clip features gunfire , physical injury and an exaggerated northern accent .
author: Neil Smith
Entertainment reporter

documents.title: bradley cooper impersonator exposed
text: the face of a man who has reportedly been gatecrashing parties at the sundance film festival in utah by pretending to be actor bradley cooper has been exposed - thanks to a fan of the star who took a selfie of himself with the impostor and posted it on instagram .
based on this evidence alone , we think the man whom one website has dubbed `` cradley booper '' is a pretty decent likeness for the oscar-nominated star of the hangover films .
but what do you think ?
let us know through the usual channels .
here 's a of the real bradley cooper for you to compare .

documents.title: 10-hour film of paint drying rated u
text: a 607-minute film of paint drying on a wall has been granted a u certificate by the british board of film classification ( bbfc ) .
journalist turned film-maker charlie lyne made the 'film ' as an act of protest against the fees the bbfc charges to classify movies .
two bbfc examiners watched the film over a period of two days before coming to the conclusion it contained `` no material likely to offend or harm '' .
( what , not even enamel cruelty ? )
here 's how lyne , who raised the money needed to submit his film to the bbfc via the kickstarter fundraising website , celebrated getting his point across .
£ 5,936 well spent .
bizarre postscript : just been told that the bbfc website crashed this afternoon after paint drying hit the front page of reddit .
thanks to whoever made an imdb entry for paint drying :
@ twitterid yes , but currently there is no running time listed !
@ twitterid that 's a pretty major oversight .

could that money not have been put to better use towards a charity or some sort .
waste of time and effort .

documents.title: academy changes 'not about political correctness '
text: the chief executive of the academy of motion picture arts and sciences - the organisation that hands out the oscars - has said new measures aimed at diversifying its membership are not about being `` politically correct '' .

following a backlash over this year 's all-white acting nominees , the academy has pledged to double the number of female and minority members by 2020 and strip voting rights from those who have not been active in the industry for the past decade .
dawn hudson ( above with academy president cheryl boone isaacs ) told the hollywood reporter the changes were part of ensuring the academy remained an elite institution .
we are the best of the best in the film industry .
we do n't feel that we have looked far and wide enough for the best of the best .
it 's not about political correctness , it 's about building the best team , the best institution , the best artists .
because unless you have the best artists voting you do n't have a real reflection of the best of our film culture .
meanwhile , animal house actor stephen furst has hit out at the proposed changes , saying the academy is being ageist and sexist .
`` one of the many reasons for the lack of diversity in nominees this year is that many members vote without watching all the films , '' he claimed in a open letter published by variety .
read the full story .

documents.title: michael douglas to be honoured at cesars
text: having brought you news earlier about catherine zeta jones , it seems fitting that her husband , actor michael douglas , should also get a look-in .

how convenient , then , that the organisers of the cesar awards - france 's version of the oscars - should choose today to announce they are to present douglas with an honorary cesar at their awards ceremony next month .
douglas will receive his accolade in paris on 26 february , two days before the oscars are handed out in los angeles .
here 's what the french academy had to say about the 71-year-old star of wall street , basic instinct and many , many more .
his unique background in american cinema makes him an absolute star , and he has become a legend in his lifetime .
gerard depardieu and isabelle huppert are among the nominees for the cesars proper , having both been shortlisted for their performances in the marital drama valley of love .

my golden days ( trois souvenirs de ma jeunesse ) , the story of an anthropologist looking back over his life , and marguerite , about a wealthy opera lover with a terrible voice , lead the field this year , having received 11 nominations each .

documents.title: is protest music dead ?
text: `` what 's happened to all the protest songs ? ''
it 's a common question among a certain generation of musicians - people who grew up with john lennon 's give peace a chance , marvin gaye 's what 's going on ?
or mississipi goddam , nina simone 's vitriolic response to the murder of four children by the ku klux klan .
well , it seems the genre is n't entirely dead - as bombay bicycle club 's jamie maccoll discovered on a radio 1 documentary last night .

the guitarist , who is related to politically-motivated singers ewan maccoll and pete seeger , looked at rap 's response to police brutality in the us and uncovered the furious subtext to hozier 's take me to church .
the conclusion ?
protest music still exists , but the messages are less explicit than in the '60s and '70s .
listen to the whole programme on the iplayer .
author: BBC Music

documents.title: ai weiwei closes exhibit in anti-denmark protest
text: chinese artist ai weiwei has pulled the plug on an exhibition of his work in denmark in protest at the country 's plans to confiscate asylum seekers ' valuables to pay for their upkeep .
his ruptures exhibition closed on wednesday at the faurschou foundation in copenhagen , having been expected to end in april .
here 's how the artist and collector jens faurschou announced the decision on instagram .
read more on this story and check out this 360 degree virtual tour of ai 's 2015 exhibition at the royal academy in london .

documents.title: watch out , oh wonder are about
text: london pop duo oh wonder have briefly turned into jeremy beadle for their new video , lose it .
the musicians , anthony west and josephine vander gucht , invited five dancers to audition for the clip , .
mid-way through their prepared routines , though , the artists were surprised by well , a surprise .
`` the dancers were truly losing it , in every sense of the word , '' said the band .
`` and it was magical to watch ``
author: Mark Savage
Music reporter

documents.title: olivier awards launch youtube channel
text: this year 's oliviers will be streamed on youtube in an effort to make the awards more accessible to a global audience .
itv will screen highlights from the ceremony , which will be held on 3 april at london 's royal opera house , with the full bash available to watch internationally on youtube shortly afterwards .
the nominations for this year 's awards will be announced on 29 february .
author: The Stage

documents.title: will smith performs about face
text: hollywood star will smith is currently touring the world promoting concussion , the american football-based drama that has gotten an awful lot of press for not landing its lead an oscar nomination .
here 's a few snaps of the independence day actor having fun in madrid on wednesday with a massive of his own face .
la verdad duele , incidentally , translates into english as `` the truth hurts '' .

documents.title: vampire weekend guitarist quits
text: rostam batmanglij , who co-wrote vampire weekend 's biggest hits with singer ezra koenig , has announced he 's leaving the band .
`` my identity as a songwriter and producer , i realised , needs to stand on its own , '' he wrote in a lengthy twitter post .
confusingly , the guitarist and keyboard player said he would continue to work with the band - who are currently recording their fourth album - while pursuing other projects .
koenig also released a statement on instagram , which attempts to make some sense of the `` is he in the-band or not ? ''
question .
a couple years ago , rostam and i sat down at his house & talked abt whether our collaboration was dependent on being members of the same band .
we both firmly agreed that nope , it was not .
in fact , we agreed that our collaboration was more important .
i 'm psyched about the work we 've already begun for lp4 and i 'm psyched to hear anything else rostam is a part of .
so that 's that cleared up , then .
rostam 's work outside vampire weekend includes collaborations with charli xcx , carly rae jepsen , haim , santigold , jenny lewis and ra ra riot .
he recently released a hymn-like solo single , eos , and has hinted that more solo material is on the way .

documents.title: broadway suffers from us snowstorm
text: the massive snowstorm that hit the east coast of the us also hit broadway box office receipts , figures show .
with new york under 26 inches ( 66 cm ) of snow , most shows were reduced to six performances instead of eight after theatres were forced to close .
the broadway league said takings for the week were $ 15.98m ( £ 11.2m ) - much lower than the previous week 's haul of $ 26.2m ( £ 18.3m ) - with every show losing money .
attendance also dropped , from 257,867 to 174,717 theatregoers .

documents.title: rihanna single premieres on radio 1
text: rihanna 's new single has just premiered on bbc radio 1 .
just as we predicted earlier , it 's called work and it 's a duet with drake .
it 's a minimal , repetitive track , rihanna declaring her love in a drowsy vocal .
`` if i get another chance to / i will never , no never neglect you , '' she slurs over a subtle dancehall beat .
you can hear it or buy it on tidal - the streaming service in which rihanna reportedly has a 3 % stake .
once you 've heard it , please let our colleagues at radio 1 know your thoughts .

documents.title: one direction release 'final ' video
text: just days before zayn malik releases his debut solo single , one direction have put out what could be their last ever video .
history is a nostalgia-packed ode to their fans , `` the greatest team the world has ever seen '' .
if the bitter-sweet lyrics do n't set you off , the video probably will .
featuring archive footage of the boyband from their fresh-faced x factor days , it 's precision-targeted at their fans ' tear ducts .
blub away .
author: Mark Savage
Music reporter

documents.title: stallone to be honoured in santa barbara
text: it 's turning into quite a january for sylvester stallone , what with a golden globe , a critics ' choice award and an oscar nomination for his comeback performance as rocky balboa in creed .
now the santa barbara international film festival is getting in on the act , having revealed the 69-year-old as the recipient of its annual montecito award .
stallone will be presented with the accolade - given each year to a performer `` who has given a series of classic and stand-out performances throughout his or her career '' - on 9 february .
here 's what the festival 's executive director , roger durling , had to say about its latest honouree .
sylvester stallone 's performance in creed has reminded us of what a true talent he is and what a joy it is to share in his successes as the many beloved characters he has created .
since he first hit the silver screen as rocky balboa nearly four decades ago , he has been a force in the industry both on film and behind the scenes .
he is a true legend in our field .
read more on this story .

documents.title: all saints announce new album
text: night swimming , beach walking , always silent , never talking girl band all saints are back , back , back !
the group - marketed as the cool alternative to the s girls in the 1990s - have largely been silent since 2007 's rock steady , which limped into the charts at number 40 .
but they 've just announced a new single - one strike , out on 26 february - with an album called red flag to follow .
the band famously fell out in 2001 over a combat jacket , which both shaznay lewis and natalie appleton wanted to wear for a photo shoot .
the incident spelled the end of their chart-topping imperial phase , but a nostalgia tour with the backstreet boys last year inspired them to return to the studio .
we did n't force ourselves into this situation , '' says natalie .
`` i just missed being with the girls .
it makes us happy . ''
the new single is described as `` lovelorn yet uplifting '' and refers to nicole appleton 's split from oasis star liam gallagher .
`` the lyrics came from somewhere very real , '' says lewis , the band 's chief songwriter .
`` nic was going through a lot of things at that time .
that was at the forefront of my mind because it was the heaviest thing going on . ''
nicole 's sister natalie adds : the first few times i heard it in my car i could n't stop crying , because i could hear so clearly what it was about . ''
we do n't get to hear the record for a while yet - so let 's revisit one of the band 's biggest songs , pure shores , which hit number one in 2000 .
red flag / the new album / 08.04.16 / # allsaints2016 @ twitterid

documents.title: woman 's hour launches late-night show
text: radio 4 's woman 's hour is to launch a regular late-night programme hosted by lauren laverne .
an eight-part series of late night woman 's hour was broadcast in august last year , and now the show has graduated to a monthly slot .
the first episode launches tomorrow , with each edition available first as an extended podcast on the last thursday of the month , before being broadcast on radio 4 the following day .
february 's woman 's hour will also launch the green room , a bbc pilot video project aimed at younger women .
here 's what laverne ( to say about the programme .
i 'm so excited to be part of the woman 's hour team .
woman 's hour has a wonderful history , but has also never felt more relevant .
i 've been a listener for years and hope that our late-night shows can continue the programme 's fearless , surprising and engaging line of inquiry , finding out more about women 's lives today .

documents.title: sundance : slave biopic 'sells for $ 17.5m '
text: a film about the leader of an 1831 slave revolt in virginia has been snapped up at sundance for a reported $ 17.5m ( £ 12.2m ) .
if the amount fox searchlight is said to have shelled out for the birth of a nation 's worldwide distribution rights is indeed accurate , it would be the largest ever generated by a sundance title .

nate parker 's film about nat turner , a slave who taught himself to read and became a preacher before ultimately leading a deadly rebellion , has certainly caught the zeitgeist at this year 's festival , arriving as it does in the midst of a heated debate about racial diversity in hollywood .
the title of the film is similarly charged , being the same as a dw griffith epic from 1915 whose heroic de of the ku klux klan continues to be divisive and contentious .
it is understood netflix bid even more - as much as $ 20m ( £ 14m ) - for parker 's film , which fox searchlight now plans to position as a year-end awards contender .
here 's how the company and the director marked the sale on twitter .
we are so incredibly proud to welcome @ twitterid # thebirthofanation to the searchlight family !

wonderful things on the horizon !

documents.title: will streaming kill live music ?
text: as more and more singers are discovered on youtube , does it spell the end for the uk 's small music venues ?
thankfully , the answer seems to be `` no '' .
we spoke to record labels and youtube channel sbtv and they both said they insist on seeing artists play live before signing them up .
but what 's it like being in a new band when talent scouts come to watch your show ?
wolf alice drummer joel amey recalls the experience with a degree of terror .
`` they 're the most exciting and nerve-wracking things that happen to you as a small band , '' he said , `` because before that there 's a year of empty rooms in the same venues .
`` then suddenly something clicks and there 's industry there , and you play all the songs way too fast and everything goes wrong in front of everyone . ''
one of the people putting the frighteners on wolf alice was chris mccourt from atlantic records .
although the label did n't end up signing the band , he recalls their early gigs with fondness .
`` they were always good live .
now , they 're really , really good , '' he said .
`` they 've done the circuit and that 's been a massive help .
seeing their growth has been really rewarding . ''
watch highlights of the band 's glastonbury set below - and read a full report on the future of the uk 's small venues .
author: Mark Savage
Music reporter

twitter uk has decided to create some new emojis in honour of this year 's brit awards , unveiling the first , for coldplay and little mix , this morning .

documents.title: prince charles meets great pottery throw down stars
text: if you watched bbc two 's the great pottery throw down last year , you 'll be familiar with middleport pottery , where the series was filmed .
prince charles visited the location on tuesday to open the new prince of wales studios , which was refurbished through the prince 's regeneration trust .
he was met there by throw down host sara cox , along with some of the show 's finalists .
judge keith brymer jones even threw some pots .

documents.title: kanye west - coming to a cinema near you
text: kanye west 's new album was supposed to be ready in time for his glastonbury appearance last summer .
but , like rihanna , he kept pushing the record back as he pursued perfection .
( at least that 's the official line .
for all we know , he was binge-watching downton abbey all year . )
but the record was finally wrapped up on monday , with the ever-modest mr west proclaiming he was `` so happy to be finished with the best album of all time '' .
except he was n't quite done .
kanye just updated his twitter feed with an updated tracklisting , and announced the album had changed its name from swish to waves .
fans will get to hear it first at a lavish launch party in new york 's madison square garden on 11 february .
the 90-minute show will include a performance curated by italian conceptual artist vanessa beecroft , who is known for large-scale works often involving live models .
her installation at the 2007 venice biennale featured 30 sudanese women lying face-down on a white canvas in what was intended to be a representation of the genocide in darfur .
uk viewers will have a chance to join the party at vue cinemas , which will be screening the event live .
author: Mark Savage
Music reporter

documents.title: godfather actor abe vigoda dies at 94
text: abe vigoda , who played doomed mafia soldier sal tessio in the godfather , has died aged 94 .
fans will remember him from his most famous line in the film , said to family adviser tom hagen just before he was killed off : `` tell mike it was only business .
i always liked him . ''
in 1982 people magazine mistakenly reported he had died .
his `` death '' went on to become a running joke in the industry , with vigoda frequently appearing on us chat shows to prove he was alive .
the actor took the people story in good humour at the time and responded by placing an ad in trade paper variety , with a photo of himself sitting in a coffin and holding a copy of the magazine .
a number of stars paid tribute to the actor on twitter , including his look who 's talking co-star kirstie alley and comic actors dane cook and andy richter .
read the full story .

documents.title: dad 's army film gets mixed reviews
text: the reviews are out for the new dad 's army film , and they 're almost as much of a mixed bunch as the walmington-on-sea home guard itself .
the independent 's sean o'grady has given it a five-star rave , claiming oliver parker 's film `` surpasses the original '' with its `` exceptionally strong cast '' .
other newspapers , though , have been far less effusive , with the guardian calling it `` a waste of talent '' in its two-star write-up .
the telegraph 's robbie collin was equally unimpressed by the film 's `` feeble '' double-entendres , `` puny '' script and `` simpering , chocolate-box prettiness '' .
the daily mirror , meanwhile , is positively hostile , describing the film as a `` career-killing catastrophe [ with ] all the humour of a v2 rocket attack '' .

somewhere in the middle lies the daily mail 's brian viner , who says the film has a `` gentle charm and a few bursts of inspired physical comedy while never reaching anything like the heights of the original at its glorious best '' .
make up your own mind when dad 's army invades cinemas on 5 february .

documents.title: costa winner : children 's fiction 'a beautiful jungle '
text: the author of the novel that was named costa book of the year last night has urged readers to explore fictional books written for young adults and children .
frances hardinge , whose victorian murder mystery the lie tree is only the second children 's novel to win the prize , said there was `` a beautiful jungle out there '' waiting to be explored .
the lie tree , hardinge 's seventh novel , tells the story of faith sunderly , a teenage girl who discovers a strange tree that feeds off whispered lies .
james heneage , chair of the costa judges , called the book - which beat four other titles to the £ 30,000 prize - `` a fantastic story with great central characters '' .
read more on this story .

documents.title: tributes paid to wonderful life singer black
text: singer colin vearncombe , who performed under the name black , has died at the age of 53 , two weeks after being injured in a car crash .
the liverpool singer had a top 10 hit around the world in 1987 with the stately ballad wonderful life , and continued to tour and release music .
fellow liverpool musician pete wylie of '80s band the mighty wah !
paid tribute to his friend on twitter , saying the news was `` just so very sad '' .
`` i could still sing the very first song colin recorded with me in the wah !
studio .
i remember it that clearly .
and that voice ! ''
other tributes were paid by actor david morrissey , music critic pete paphides and indie band the farm .

documents.title: dad 's army film premieres in london
text: the cast of the new dad 's army film were all present and correct last night as the big-screen version of the classic bbc sitcom had its world premiere in central london .

this shows daniel mays , toby jones , sir michael gambon , catherine zeta jones , blake harrison , sir tom courtenay and bill paterson wisely taking shelter indoors from the inclement conditions outside .
outsized umbrellas were the order of the day outside the cinema , as this shot of zeta jones with four chelsea pensioners shows .
will umbrellas be enough to shield the film from the critics though ?
do n't panic - we 'll be bringing you a reviews round-up shortly .

documents.title: get involved with the news
text: we know it 's early and it 's tough to get brains in gear at this time of day , but if you fancy sharing your thoughts on anything in today 's news , get in touch .
tweet @ twitterid email entertainment.news @ bbc.co.uk .
author: Genevieve Hassan
Entertainment reporter

documents.title: hello all
text: a warm welcome to wednesday 's live page , especially if you 've woken up to another wet and windy morning .
we ca n't do anything about the weather , but we can certainly keep you up to date with everything that 's going on in the world of arts and entertainment .
today we 'll be bringing you the first word on the new dad 's army film , which had its premiere last night in - yes - a wet and windy leicester square .
in the meantime , here 's everything we brought you on tuesday 's live page - just in case you missed it .
author: Neil Smith
Entertainment reporter
